newsitem.title: JAPAN: M'bishi Heavy to build acrylic acid plant in China.
newsitem.headline: M'bishi Heavy to build acrylic acid plant in China.

text.p: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd said on Tuesday that it, Nippon Shokubai Co Ltd and Nissho Iwai Corp have jointly won an order to build an acrylic acid plant in China.
The order, issued by the China National Chemical Construction Corp, is worth about four billion yen, a Mitsubishi Heavy spokesman said.

The plant's construction is expected to be completed by the end of 1998. The plant's annual production capacity will be 30,000 tonnes of acrylic acid, 12,000 tonnes of high-purity acrylic acid and 30,000 tonnes of butyl acrylate, the company said in a statement.
Acrylic acid is used to make such products as disposable diapers.
